Property description


Our triplex at 2638 Woolsey offers a 3-bedroom, a 4-bedroom,
and a 1-bedroom apartment. Built in the early 1920s, the building has all the
charm and character you would expect from an Elmwood home. You'll have access
to a beautiful shared back garden that features luxurious cool grass and a
paved stone area perfect for sitting with a glass of iced tea on a warm summer
day.

The building's prominent windows open to welcome cool spring breezes and close to allow the warm autumn light to filter through. The spacious rooms and hardwood floors, combined with the wonderful natural light, give each apartment a welcoming, homey feel. Enjoy lazy Sunday morning breakfasts at your large eat-in kitchen, complete with a gas stove. The super large 3 bedroom apartment takes up the southern half of the top floor and has beautiful hardwood floors, a spacious kitchen and tons of natural lighting from the surrounding windows in the unit. It is a truly amazing place and one-of-a-kind must see! In addition, there is a shared garden in the back of the property with fruit trees and on-site laundry.
Neighborhood InformationNeighborhood description

Located in the heart of the Historic Elmwood District, this building is literally steps away from Zagat-rated restaurants, bustling small-town vibes, vintage & fashion stores, gourmet boutiques and countless cafes. UC campus is only 20 minutes walking, or less than 10 minutes on AC Transit 51 line. Our unique location is also steps away from world-class medical, dental and emergency facilities, with the Alta Bates Hospital Complex only 0.2 miles away.


A short walk from the Rockridge or Ashby BART stations, it is only 25 minutes away from San Francisco downtown & mission areas, Walnut Creek business district, and OAK international airport. Access to all freeways is a breeze with close proximity to CA-24, and I-880. And when not in use, park your car in our designated tree-shaded courtyard.
